name: D3
desc:
D3.js (or just D3 for Data-Driven Documents) is a JavaScript library for producing dynamic, interactive data visualizations in web browsers. It makes use of the widely implemented SVG, HTML5, and CSS standards.
This infographic you are viewing is made with D3.

name: Bootstrap
desc:
Bootstrap is a free and open-source front-end web framework for designing websites
		and web applications. It contains HTML-and CSS-based design templates for typography,
		forms, buttons, navigation and other interfacecomponents, as well as optional JavaScript extensions.

name: ExpressJS
desc:
Express.js, or simply Express, is a JavaScript framework designed for building web applications and APIs.
		It is the de facto server framework for Node.js.

name: Yeoman
desc:
Yeoman is an open source, command-line interface set of tools mainly used to generate
		structure and scaffolding for new projects, especially in JavaScript and Node.js.
		At Nau, we have developed a Yeoman generator that help quickly set up new projects aligned with
		Nau's conventions and standards.

name: MongoDB
desc:
The de-facto Database solution for JavaScript and Node.js applications. It is a light weight,
		high performance NoSQL database and can be used for small and large websites.

name: Jekyll
desc: Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware, static site generator for personal, project, or organization sites. Written in Ruby by Tom Preston-Werner, GitHub's co-founder, it is distributed under an open source license.

name: JavaScript
desc:
JavaScript is the heart of modern Web front end development and essential element of any Single Page
		Applications. In Nau, we invest a good deal in training developers to have good control of this universal language
		and now caplable of developing full stack websites with only JavaScript.

name: SCSS
desc:
This is our main CSS preprocessor language helping us lay structured foundation to CSS as well
		as assisting on writing more convenient BEM anotations.

name: TypeScript2
desc:
The strict-typing flavor of ECMAScript, always requires a compiler to compile to vanilla JavaScript
		but the type checking and other syntactical sugar are exceptional. Right now, we only use it for
		Angular2 projects when needed.

name: BabelJS
desc: The de-facto tool to work with ECMAScript 6 and ReactJS nowadays.

name: ESLint
desc: The tool to check and validate JavaScript code when we develop and prevent potential issues with code.

name: GulpJS
desc:
GulpJS is a task automation tools written for Node.js. It is among the most popular
		Front End and Node project automation tools nowadays

name: Webpack
desc: A module bundler library that is becoming de-facto tool to use in ReactJS or SPA apps nowadays.

name: NodeJS
desc:
Node.js is a cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment. 
		Node.js allows creation of high performance and high concurrency websites with smaller footprint compared to
		other server-side solution. Node.js ecosystem is growing very fast and is trusted by a lot of big companies who
		are adopting it to enhance current products as well as for new ones.

name: jQuery
desc: Deprecated, because youmightnotneedjquery.com

name: Passport
desc: Passport is authentication middleware for Node.js. Extremely flexible and modular, Passport can be unobtrusively dropped in to any Express-based web application. A comprehensive set of strategies support authentication using a username and password, Facebook, Twitter, and more.

name: DOTNETCore
desc: .NET Core is a general purpose development platform maintained by Microsoft and the .NET community on GitHub. It is cross-platform, supporting Windows, macOS and Linux, and can be used in device, cloud, and embedded/IoT scenarios.

name: DOTNET
desc: .NET Framework (pronounced dot net) is a software framework developed by Microsoft that runs primarily on Microsoft Windows.

name: ASPDOTNET
desc: ASP.NET is an open-source server-side web application framework designed for web development to produce dynamic web pages. It was developed by Microsoft to allow programmers to build dynamic web sites, web applications and web services.

name: C#
desc: C# (pronounced as see sharp) is a multi-paradigm programming language encompassing strong typing, imperative, declarative, functional, generic, object-oriented (class-based), and component-oriented programming disciplines.

name: Unity3D
desc: Unity is een cross-platform game-engine ontwikkeld door het Deens-Amerikaanse bedrijf Unity Technologies voor de ontwikkeling van computerspellen voor zowel de pc, consoles, mobiele apparaten als websites.

name: Electron
desc: Electron (formerly known as Atom Shell) is an open-source framework created by Cheng Zhao, and now developed by GitHub.

name: React
desc: In computing, React (sometimes styled React.js or ReactJS) is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

name: C
desc: C is a general-purpose, imperative computer programming language, supporting structured programming, lexical variable scope and recursion, while a static type system prevents many unintended operations. By design, C provides constructs that map efficiently to typical machine instructions, and therefore it has found lasting use in applications that had formerly been coded in assembly language, including operating systems, as well as various application software for computers ranging from supercomputers to embedded systems.

name: Heroku
desc: Heroku is a platform as a service (PaaS) that enables developers to build, run, and operate applications entirely in the cloud.

name: Go
desc: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

name: Angular
desc: Angular (commonly referred to as "Angular2+" or "Angular2") is a TypeScript-based open-source front-end web application platform led by the Angular Team at Google and by a community of individuals and corporations to address all of the parts of the developer's workflow while building complex web applications.

name: AngularJS
desc: AngularJS is what HTML would have been, had it been designed for building web-apps. Declarative templates with data-binding, MVW, MVVM, MVC, dependency injection and great testability story all implemented with pure client-side JavaScript!

name: Clojure
desc: Clojure is a dynamic, general-purpose programming language, combining the approachability and interactive development of a scripting language with an efficient and robust infrastructure for multithreaded programming.

name: Cordova
desc: Apache Cordova enables software programmers to build applications for mobile devices using CSS3, HTML5, and JavaScript instead of relying on platform-specific APIs like those in Android, iOS, or Windows Phone.

name: CSS
desc: CSS is a language that describes the style of an HTML document.

name: HTML5
desc: HTML5 is a markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web. It is the fifth and current major version of the HTML standard.

name: EJS
desc: EJS is a client-side templating language that was originally part of JavaScriptMVC, which has now been replaced by DoneJS.

name: FabricJS
desc: Fabric.js is a powerful and simple. Javascript HTML5 canvas library. Fabric provides interactive object model on top of canvas element.

name: F#
desc: F# is a mature, open source, cross-platform, functional-first programming language. It empowers users and organizations to tackle complex computing problems with simple, maintainable and robust code.

name: Haskell
desc: Haskell is a standardized, general-purpose purely functional programming language, with non-strict semantics and strong static typing.

name: Git
desc: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in computer files and coordinating work on those files among multiple people. It is primarily used for source code management in software development.

name: GitHub
desc: GitHub is a Web-based Git version control repository hosting service. It is mostly used for computer code.

name: React Native
desc: React Native lets you build mobile apps using only JavaScript. It uses the same design as React, letting you compose a rich mobile UI from declarative components.

name: Rust
desc: Rust is a systems programming language that runs blazingly fast, prevents segfaults, and guarantees thread safety.

name: SQL
desc: SQL is a standard language for storing, manipulating and retrieving data in databases.

name: SysML
desc: The Systems Modeling Language (SysML) is a general-purpose modeling language for systems engineering applications.

name: UML
desc: The Unified Modeling Language (UML) is a general-purpose, developmental, modeling language in the field of software engineering, that is intended to provide a standard way to visualize the design of a system.

name: TSLint
desc: TSLint is an extensible static analysis tool that checks TypeScript code for readability, maintainability, and functionality errors. It is widely supported across modern editors & build systems and can be customized with your own lint rules, configurations, and formatters.

name: Visual Studio
desc: Microsoft Visual Studio is an integrated development environment (IDE) from Microsoft. It is used to develop computer programs for Microsoft Windows, as well as web sites, web apps, web services and mobile apps.

name: Visual Studio Code
desc: Visual Studio Code is a source code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS. It includes support for debugging, embedded Git control, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, and code refactoring.

name: Web Assembly
desc: WebAssembly or wasm is a low-level bytecode format for in-browser client-side scripting, evolved from JavaScript. Its initial aim is to support compilation from C and C++, though other source languages such as Rust are also supported.

name: Xamarin
desc: Xamarin is a Microsoft-owned San Francisco, California-based software company founded in May 2011 by the engineers that created Mono, Mono for Android and MonoTouch, which are cross-platform implementations of the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) and Common Language Specifications (often called Microsoft .NET).

name: XML
desc: Extensible Markup Language (XML) is a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable. The W3C's XML 1.0 Specification and several other related specifications, all of them free open standardsâ€”define XML.

name: XAML
desc: Extensible Application Markup Language is a declarative XML-based language developed by Microsoft that is used for initializing structured values and objects. It is available under Microsoft's Open Specification Promise.

name: NUnit
desc: NUnit is a unit-testing framework for all .Net languages. Initially ported from JUnit, the current production release, version 3, has been completely rewritten with many new features and support for a wide range of .NET platforms.

name: NDepend
desc: NDepend is a static analysis tool for .NET managed code.

name: OnsenUI
desc: The most beautiful and efficient way to develop HTML5 hybrid and mobile web apps.

name: Firebase
desc: Firebase is Google's mobile platform that helps you quickly develop high-quality apps and grow your business.

name: RxJs
desc: RxJS is a library for reactive programming using Observables, to make it easier to compose asynchronous or callback-based code.

name: C++
desc: C++ is a general-purpose programming language. It has imperative, object-oriented and generic programming features, while also providing facilities for low-level memory manipulation.

name: PHP
desc: PHP is a server-side scripting language designed for web development but also used as a general-purpose programming language.

name: Wordpress
desc: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system (CMS) based on PHP and MySQL.

name: Java
desc: Java is a general-purpose computer programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented, and specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

name: Pug
desc: Pug is a high-performance template engine heavily influenced by Haml and implemented with JavaScript for Node.js and browsers.

name: Redux
desc: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps.

name: Preact
desc: Fast 3kB alternative to React with the same modern API.

name: Forestry.io
desc: A content management system for static sites built with Hugo and Jekyll.

name: PostCSS
desc: Transform CSS with the power of JavaScript. Auto-prefixing, future CSS syntaxes, modules, linting and more are possible with hundreds of PostCSS plugins.

name: NPM
desc: npm is a package manager for the JavaScript programming language. It is the default package manager for the JavaScript runtime environment Node.js.

name: CMake
desc: CMake is an open-source, cross-platform family of tools designed to build, test and package software.

name: Monaca
desc: Give Power to Your Cordova Apps. Monaca supercharges Cordova app development with easy to use tools, services and UI framework.

name: Material-UI
desc: React components that implement Google's Material Design.

name: PostgreSQL
desc: PostgreSQL is an open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) emphasizing extensibility and standards compliance.

name: GatsbyJS
desc: Blazing fast modern site generator for React. Go beyond static sites: build blogs, ecommerce sites, full-blown apps, and more with Gatsby.

name: GraphQL
desc: GraphQL is a query language for your API, and a server-side runtime for executing queries by using a type system you define for your data. GraphQL isn't tied to any specific database or storage engine and is instead backed by your existing code and data.

name: Netlify
desc: Netlify builds, deploys and hosts your front-end.

name: Cloudflare
desc: The Web Performance & Security Company.
